commitMessage:
fix: add prettier formatting to sync-claude-commands.js (HODGE-303)

## What Changed
- Modified scripts/sync-claude-commands.js (10 lines added)
  - Added prettier formatting step after TypeScript generation
  - Graceful error handling with try/catch and warnings
  - Uses stdio: 'pipe' to suppress prettier output

- Created scripts/sync-claude-commands.test.ts (NEW - 107 lines)
  - 6 comprehensive smoke tests
  - Tests cover: valid TypeScript, formatting, performance, content preservation, consistency, error handling
  - Uses backup/restore pattern for test isolation

## Why This Change
The GitHub Actions "Quality Checks" workflow was failing on prettier check while 
local checks passed. Root cause: the build script runs `npm run sync:commands` 
which regenerates src/lib/claude-commands.ts, but the generated code wasn't 
formatted, causing CI to fail after build step.

Flow was:
- CI: checkout → build (regenerates file with different formatting) → prettier ❌
- Local: build (already done) → prettier check on uncommitted version ✅

This fix ensures generated code is always properly formatted in both CI and 
local environments by running prettier automatically during code generation.

## Impact
- ✅ CI prettier checks now pass after build step
- ✅ No uncommitted changes after running build
- ✅ Zero developer friction (automatic formatting)
- ✅ Consistent formatting across environments
- ✅ Graceful degradation if prettier fails
- ✅ All 611 tests passing (including 6 new smoke tests)
- ✅ Build time impact negligible (<100ms for prettier)

Closes HODGE-303
